body:
The [template plugin](https://github.com/technosophos/helm-template) fills a need for chart developers and testing systems that need to work without requiring an active Tiller or k8s cluster. 

## Problem
The template plugin does not provide parity with Helm with regards to newer features that alter final  output via mechanisms like Import Values and Tags and Conditions. Maintaining the template plugin separately is more work and will often result in an outdated feature set.

## Proposed Solution
We should integrate the template plugin functionality into core so that chart developers have a built-in command to render charts locally and see output that matches what is expected from a `helm install`.

### Implementation
The plugin can be integrated with its functionality more or less "as is" except it could be downstream in the pipeline and render what would normally be the final chart being sent to Tiller. Any new features and flags should "just work" with the template output. 

### Considerations
Much of the Tiller rendering logic will be compiled into the Helm client increasing the size of the binary and increasing maintenance costs due to adding a new (small) feature.

### Command
The command `template` would be added and would render all templates in the final chart (including its sub-charts) to standard out:
```
helm template foo
```
The above command would render all templates in the foo chart and its sub-charts
```
---
# Source: foo/templates/service.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: RELEASE-NAME-foo
...
```

## Opens
Since the output only contains rendered templates, should we include a `--debug` flag so that developers can see computed values etc?
title: proposal: Integrate 'template' plugin functionality
